definitions.definition: A mark left by something that has passed along.
definitions.example: Can you see any tracks in the snow?

definitions.definition: A mark or impression left by the foot, either of man or animal.
definitions.example: The fox tracks were still visible in the snow.

definitions.definition: The entire lower surface of the foot; said of birds, etc.
A road or other similar beaten path.
definitions.example: Follow the track for a hundred metres.

definitions.definition: Physical course; way.
definitions.example: Astronomers predicted the track of the comet.

definitions.definition: A path or course laid out for a race, for exercise, etc.
definitions.example: The athletes ran round the track.

definitions.definition: The direction and progress of someone or something; path.
The way or rails along which a train moves.
definitions.example: They briefly closed the railway to remove debris found on the track.

definitions.definition: A tract or area, such as of land.
The street, as a prostitute's place of work.
Awareness of something, especially when arising from close monitoring.
The distance between two opposite wheels on a same axletree.
Short for caterpillar track.
The pitch.
Sound stored on a record.
The physical track on a record.
A song or other relatively short piece of music, on a record, separated from others by a short silence.
definitions.example: My favourite track on the album is "Sunshine".

definitions.definition: A circular (never-ending) data storage unit on a side of magnetic or optical disk, divided into sectors.
The racing events of track and field; track and field in general.
definitions.example: I'm going to try out for track next week.

definitions.definition: A session talk on a conference.
To continue over time.
To follow the tracks of.
definitions.example: My uncle spent all day tracking the deer, whose hoofprints were clear in the mud.

definitions.definition: To make tracks on.
To create a musical recording (a track).
definitions.example: Lil Kyle is gonna track with that DJ next week.

definitions.definition: To make sense; to be consistent with known information
